document.extractedText:
FREELANCE SERVICE AGREEMENT

This Service Agreement ("Agreement") is entered into between Client Corp ("Client") and Contractor ("Freelancer").

1. NON-COMPETE CLAUSE
The Contractor shall not compete with Client or engage in any similar business activities for a period of 2 years after termination of this agreement. Contractor agrees not to work for any competitor of Client during and after this engagement. This restraint of trade provision is essential to protect Client's interests.

2. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY
All intellectual property, work product, inventions, developments, and any materials created by Contractor shall belong exclusively to Client in perpetuity. Contractor hereby assigns all IP rights including moral rights to Client. This includes any pre-existing work incorporated into deliverables.

3. LIABILITY AND INDEMNIFICATION
Contractor assumes unlimited liability for all damages arising from this agreement, including consequential damages, indirect damages, and loss of profits. Contractor shall indemnify Client against all claims without limitation.

4. PAYMENT TERMS
Payment shall be made within 120 days of invoice submission, subject to Client receiving payment from its end customers. Client may withhold payment for any reason at its sole discretion.

5. TERMINATION
Client may terminate this agreement immediately without cause or notice at any time at its sole discretion. Contractor cannot terminate and must continue providing services until Client terminates.

6. JURISDICTION AND GOVERNING LAW
This agreement shall be governed by the laws of Delaware, USA. All disputes shall be resolved in the courts of California, United States of America. Indian courts shall have no jurisdiction.

7. SCOPE OF WORK
Contractor shall perform services as required by Client from time to time. Additional work may be assigned at Client's discretion without additional compensation. Contractor must be available 24/7.

8. PENALTY CLAUSE
In case of any breach by Contractor, Contractor shall pay a penalty equal to 10x the contract value as liquidated damages. This penalty is in addition to any other damages.

SIGNATURES:
_____________________
Client Representative

_____________________
Contractor

riskyClauses.originalText:
1. NON-COMPETE CLAUSE
The Contractor shall not compete with Client or engage in any similar business activities for a period of 2 years after termination of this agreement. Contractor agrees not to work for any competitor of Client during and after this engagement. This restraint of trade provision is essential to protect Client's interests.

indianLawReference.title: Agreement in restraint of trade void
indianLawReference.fullText: Every agreement by which anyone is restrained from exercising a lawful profession, trade or business of any kind, is to that extent void.
indianLawReference.summary: Non-compete clause restricting freelancer from taking other work

explanation.simple: This clause tries to prevent you from working with competitors or taking similar freelance projects.
explanation.realLifeImpact: Under Section 27 of the Indian Contract Act, 1872, such broad restrictions on your ability to earn a livelihood are VOID and cannot be enforced. You cannot be legally prevented from taking other freelance work in your field.

riskyClauses.originalText:
2. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY
All intellectual property, work product, inventions, developments, and any materials created by Contractor shall belong exclusively to Client in perpetuity. Contractor hereby assigns all IP rights including moral rights to Client. This includes any pre-existing work incorporated into deliverables.

indianLawReference.title: What agreements are contracts
indianLawReference.fullText: All agreements are contracts if they are made by the free consent of parties competent to contract, for a lawful consideration and with a lawful object, and are not hereby expressly declared to be void.
indianLawReference.summary: Transfers all IP rights without scope limitation or compensation

explanation.simple: This clause may be risky. Review carefully.
explanation.realLifeImpact: Could affect your ability to work freely.

riskyClauses.originalText:
3. LIABILITY AND INDEMNIFICATION
Contractor assumes unlimited liability for all damages arising from this agreement, including consequential damages, indirect damages, and loss of profits. Contractor shall indemnify Client against all claims without limitation.

indianLawReference.title: Compensation for loss or damage caused by breach of contract
indianLawReference.fullText: When a contract has been broken, the party who suffers by such breach is entitled to receive, from the party who has broken the contract, compensation for any loss or damage caused to him thereby.
indianLawReference.summary: Freelancer liable for unlimited damages without reasonable cap

explanation.simple: This clause makes you liable for all damages without any upper limit.
explanation.realLifeImpact: If something goes wrong (even beyond your control), you could be forced to pay unlimited amounts. Indian Contract Act Section 73 allows only "reasonable" compensation. This clause may be challenged as unconscionable.

riskyClauses.originalText:
7. SCOPE OF WORK
Contractor shall perform services as required by Client from time to time. Additional work may be assigned at Client's discretion without additional compensation. Contractor must be available 24/7.

indianLawReference.title: What agreements are contracts
indianLawReference.fullText: All agreements are contracts if they are made by the free consent of parties competent to contract, for a lawful consideration and with a lawful object, and are not hereby expressly declared to be void.
indianLawReference.summary: Work scope not clearly defined, leading to scope creep

explanation.simple: This clause may be risky. Review carefully.
explanation.realLifeImpact: Could affect your ability to work freely.

8. PENALTY CLAUSE
In case of any breach by Contractor, Contractor shall pay a penalty equal to 10x the contract value as liquidated damages. This penalty is in addition to any other damages.

SIGNATURES:
_____________________
Client Representative

_____________________
Contractor

indianLawReference.title: Compensation for breach of contract where penalty stipulated for
indianLawReference.fullText: When a contract has been broken, if a sum is named in the contract as the amount to be paid in case of such breach, the party complaining of the breach is entitled to receive from the party who has broken the contract reasonable compensation not exceeding the amount so named.
indianLawReference.summary: Excessive penalty that exceeds reasonable compensation for breach

explanation.simple: This clause imposes a very high penalty for breach of contract.
explanation.realLifeImpact: Under Section 74, you can only be required to pay "reasonable compensation" for actual losses, not punitive penalties. If the penalty is excessive, Indian courts will reduce it.

deviations.explanation: Your contract has 120-day payment terms, which is 90 days beyond the standard Net 30. This creates significant cash flow risk for freelancers.
You could be forced to pay unlimited damages. Fair contracts cap liability at the project value.
Disputes must be resolved in foreign courts, which is expensive and impractical for Indian freelancers. This heavily favors the client.

disclaimer: This analysis is for educational purposes only. It does not constitute legal advice. Consult a qualified lawyer before signing any contract.
